thread.section_title: The Tribune, Chandigarh, India : Latest news, India, Punjab, Chandigarh, Haryana, Himachal, Uttarakhand, J&K, sports, cricket
thread.title: Woman withdraws complaint against Mishra

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Woman withdraws complaint against Mishra
text:
Bengaluru
In a big relief for Amit Mishra, the woman who had filed a police complaint against him has decided to withdraw the case. “Two days after lodging the complaint, I approached the police station and told them that I have decided to withdraw the case,” the complainant said. “I am waiting for Mishra to appear in the police station. We will amicably withdraw the case. We were friends. We fought, and will continue to remain friends,” she said. Karachi
Indo-Pak series not ruled out yet: Shukla Rajeev Shukla, a senior BCCI official, has insisted that the planned bilateral series between Pakistan and India in December is still not a closed chapter. He also said that the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) delegation that visited Mumbai a few days back had been accorded proper hospitality by the BCCI. Shukla’s comments came a day after PCB chairman Shaharyar Khan said that chances of holding the series were very slim. “The talks regarding the Indo-Pak bilateral series have not derailed yet and we will resume them after the India-South Africa series ends,” he said. Bengaluru
Somdev shocked at AirAsia Open tennis Unseeded Italian Alessandro Bega ousted top seed Somdev Devvarman in straight sets to coast into the quarterfinals of the AirAsia Open here on Thursday. World No. 331 Bega gave a stiff fight to Somdev, world No. 181, and eventually beat him 7-6(7), 7-5 in a tight contest. In another match, Sanam Singh made it to the last-eight with a thrilling 6-2, 2-6, 7-6 (6) victory over Egor Gerasimov of Belarus. Margao
FC Goa beat Kerala Blasters, take top spot Frenchman Gregory Arnolin’s 84th minute strike helped FC Goa edge past Kerala Blasters FC 2-1 in a keenly contested ISL football game and take the top spot in the league table here today. Into the final minutes and the game tied at 1-1, central defender Gregory, who is a French professional, scored the winner to the delight of the home fans. Colombo
Debutant Warrican stars as WI dismiss SL for 200 West Indies left-arm spinner Jomel Warrican celebrated his Test debut by capturing four wickets on the opening day of the second Test against Sri Lanka at the P Sara Oval on Thursday. Warrican mopped up the Sri Lankan tail to dismiss the home team for 200 after the West Indian pace attack had wreaked havoc on the home team’s top order in the first two sessions. Brief scores: SL 200 (Siriwardana 68, Warrican 4-67); WI: 17 for 1— Agencies Berlin
Schweinsteiger taking legal action over Nazi doll Germany captain Bastian Schweinsteiger is taking legal action against a Chinese company that manufactured a doll bearing the midfielder’s resemblance and dressed in Nazi military uniforms, a spokesman for the player said on Thursday. The figure named ‘Bastian’ and seen wearing various German World War-II military uniforms, including the swastika and eagle, symbol of Nazi Germany is on sale through the Hong-Kong based DID company. The resemblance to the Manchester United playmaker Schweinsteiger is striking. A spokesman for 31-year-old, who won the World Cup with Germany in 2014, told reporters he was taking legal action while German media were enraged by what they perceived as Nazi depiction of the player. Vienna
Ferrer in quarterfinals of Vienna Open David Ferrer further improved his chances of qualifying for the ATP World Tour Finals for the seventh time on Thursday when he reached the quarterfinals of the Vienna Open. The Spaniard, who is currently No. 8 in the ATP Race To London, added 45 points after he defeated Guillermo Garcia-Lopez 6-1 6-1 in 63 minutes. Ferrer, who recorded the 650th match win of his career with a victory over Albert Ramos-Vinolas in the first round, is now 49-12 on the year by reaching his 12th quarterfinal (or better). He has won four ATP World Tour titles in 2015. The top seed will next challenge Fabio Fognini, who beat Radek Stepanek 6-1 6-4. — Agencies
